page.title: 01LANDSCAPE CHURCH CROOKHAM
page.content: Church Crookham became a separate parish in 1841 and now is an interesting and varied,residential and recreational area. Church Crookham is inland and fairly flat. Between Thames Valley and the North Downs,it forms the boundary between the sandy Bracklesham Beds and the heavy London Clays.A large area called Tweseldown is army heathland used for exercises and public recreation.Everywhere there are trees. There is fine riding and many horses are kept.In the north Church Crookham joins the small town of Fleet.To the east lies Tweseldown Common and in the south and west are arable lands. There are five groups of shops amongst the houses, air force and army housing and Gurkha barracks. A small industrial site is being developed in the south west..
